page.title: 03Langley and District
page.content: Langley village is east of Sutton and close to Tegsnose Country Park and the Peak District National Park. It is surrounded by Macclesfield Forest and close by are the reservoirs of Bottoms, Tegsnose,Trentabank and Ridgegate,which contribute to the local water supply. Langley village had its own primary school,now a Teachers Centre,a Chapel and local store and post office are still there. It is well known for its silk screen printing industry which still exists at Langley Screens and Park Adams and a textile machinery factory, Rieter_Scraggs The village is in an area of great natural beauty,dominated by Tegsnose with its surrounding country park and the reservoirs bordered by Macclesfield Forest .
